item.title: October 28 Will Be A Big Day For Guild Wars 2
item.description:
On July 15, Guild Wars 2 revealed its sixth expansion, Visions of Eternity , which is scheduled to go live on Tuesday, October 28, following a two-month delay. The upcoming Guild Wars 2 expansion will feature new elite specializations and enhancements like an upgraded skimmer mount, fashion templates, and a consolidated raid and strike interface.

Guild Wars 2 's next expansion will take players to the remote island of Castora, a place that has long been thought not to even exist due to its location and mysteries. Castora will feature two open-world regions at the expansion's launch for players to explore. As the main story of Visions of Eternity progresses over 2025 and 2026, two more zones will be unlocked. Following weeks of teasers by Guild Wars 2 on social media, Visions of Eternity will bring back Elite Specializations, as each profession will get new trait lines, mechanics, and skills that give players new ways to customize their characters. An open beta test focused on elite specializations is scheduled for August 20 to 27.

Weeks after announcing that the launch of Visions of Eternity would be delayed by two months, Guild Wars 2 gave players a look at the game's future. Guild Wars 2: Visions of Eternity will go live on Tuesday, October 28, at approximately Noon Eastern. ArenaNet shared the first details about Visions of Eternity via a short trailer that lasted over a minute. Along with the updates to the game's professions, Visions of Eternity will see some upgrades to the Skimmer mount, which will allow players easier passage through Castora's wild environments. Additionally, Guild Wars 2 transmog collectors will get a major upgrade, as fashion templates will allow players to save their favorite cosmetics and swap between them as easily as build and equipment templates already do.

Guild Wars 2: Visions of Eternity Launches October 28

Pre-orders for Guild Wars 2: Visions of Eternity are now available starting at $24.99 for the Standard Edition. Unlike previous updates, Visions of Eternity 's elite specializations will not offer new weapon choices to players, but instead give professions like the magical Elementalist new abilities and customization options. Guild Wars 2 's raids and strikes will also be streamlined under a new structure that will go live in 2026, along with new systems to encourage group content.

Guild Wars 2 players who own both Janthir Wilds and Visions of Eternity will also gain access to a new Homestead. Given that Castora is an uncharted island, it remains to be seen how the latest chapter in Guild Wars 2 will play out.

item.title: One of Destiny 2’s Armor 3.0 Stats Seems Like the Clear Meta Pick
item.description:
Along with a brand-new campaign and an entire planet to explore, The Edge of Fate expansion for Destiny 2 will also be introducing major improvements to the game’s loot systems. This notably includes entirely new layers of buildcrafting tools for players to combine. It most likely won’t happen right away, but slowly and surely, this new generation of buildcrafting tools in Destiny 2 will eventually come to replace the existing meta.

As players begin navigating this new meta in Destiny 2 ’s Edge of Fate expansion, players should consider prioritizing one new buildcrafting tool, in particular: the weapons character stat. Not only can this stat provide a powerful, universal foundation for endgame builds, but it can also open up countless possibilities for creativity and experimentation that previously weren’t viable in the former Armor 2.0 loot system. So, compared to the other new character stats coming in the Armor 3.0 system, the weapons stat arguably seems like the clear meta pick.

Destiny 2’s New Armor 3.0 Weapons Stat Gives Players the Keys to the Kingdom

What Does Destiny 2’s New Weapon Stat Do?

  • 0-100 Weapon Stat Benefits: Increases primary, energy, and heavy weapons’ reload speed, handling, and damage against minor and major enemies.
  • 100-200 Weapon Stat Benefits: Increases the chance of ammo bricks to contain additional ammo, and improves primary, energy, and heavy weapons’ damage against bosses and Guardians.

Why Players Shouldn’t Sleep on Destiny 2’s Weapons Stat

Admittedly, the nature of improving players' weapon damage against Guardians ultimately makes this character stat a mandatory investment for Destiny 2 ’s PvP meta builds. However, this was already a mandatory investment before Destiny 2 ’s Armor 3.0 update, except instead of a character stat, players would typically use their legendary weapons’ perks to invest in improving their weapon damage. So, with the weapons stat applying to primary, energy, and heavy weapons all in one convenient package, players who invest in this stat will finally have the freedom to use their weapon perks to provide creative utilities that were previously considered off-meta.

Even beyond PvP, this weapons stat will also be a game-changer for meta builds in Destiny 2 ’s endgame PvE content. Alongside improved weapon damage, ammo efficiency is also widely considered to be a mandatory investment for meta builds, which players would use their armor mods to invest in. Hence, while the increased weapon damage will give players more freedom when it comes to legendary weapon mods, the ammo efficiency benefits of the weapon stat will give players more freedom when it comes to armor mods.

Destiny 2’s New Armor 3.0 Weapon Stat Kills Multiple Birds With One Stone

At first, the reveal of the new Armor 3.0 weapon stat providing universal damage buffs ultimately seemed like it was going to be quite a controversial addition to Destiny 2 . However, with the weapon stat lumping together improved weapon damage, reload speed, and ammo efficiency all into one buildcrafting tool will ultimately allow meta builds to finally move away from pre-existing buildcrafting tools that already did one of these three things individually.

Especially compared to the other new Armor 3.0 character stats in Destiny 2 , which may vary in importance from build to build, like increasing the damage and recharge time of specific abilites, the benefits provided by the new weapons stat are generally much more universal. Hence, players should strongly consider prioritizing their weapons stat above all else, as this can provide near-unlimited possibilities for what kinds of builds will be viable in both endgame PvE content and competitive PvP in Destiny 2 , finally allowing players to opt for creative utilities without compromising on their weapons’ damage.

item.title: Destiny 2's Armor 3.0 Upgrade is a Controversy Waiting to Happen
item.description:
Not only does The Edge of Fate expansion mark the beginning of a new multi-year saga for Destiny 2 , the Fate saga, but it will also gradually bring about a brand-new era for the looter-shooter’s PvP and PvE metas. It may take some time for all of the new buildcrafting tools to replace the artifice armor and god-roll legendary weapons in Destiny 2 that players have earned throughout the past few years, but this new meta in Destiny 2 is arguably inevitable.

However, despite The Edge of Fate expansion for Destiny 2 making several long-overdue improvements to the game’s loot systems by adding multiple new layers of buildcrafting tools for players to master, one recurring issue is bound to resurface in due time. With gear sets, gear tiers, and the new Armor 3.0 character stats encouraging players to hunt down a whole new inventory of new and improved loot, this once again makes the lack of expanded vault space in The Edge of Fate expansion for Destiny 2 a controversy waiting to happen.

Destiny 2’s New Armor 3.0 Upgrade Solves One Problem, But Reintroduces Another

Now that legendary class items in Destiny 2 can have a variety of unique gear set bonuses and Armor 3.0 character stats, this finally gives players a reason to collect multiple legendary class items. Whereas before, legendary class items all had the same character stats, and their only distinction was that some of them offered reputation or loot bonuses for specific activities. So, with the old Armor 2.0 system, players only ever needed to keep a small handful of legendary class items, and anything beyond this could be safely dismantled.

Destiny 2’s Edge of Fate Expansion Not Adding More Vault Space May Come Back to Bite It

Legendary class items aren’t the only new loot that players will want to chase when this expansion arrives. From this point onwards, all legendary armor sets will have a gear set bonus, as well as a gear tier, and a random selection of character stats. This new gear tiering system is also coming to weapons, too. Overall, players will have a virtually unlimited supply of new and improved gear to collect, and this new generation of buildcrafting tools will only continue to grow throughout Destiny 2 ’s Year of Prophecy. Unfortunately, though, while players are encouraged to replace all of their old loot with loot that utilizes the new Armor 3.0 stats, gear set bonuses, and gear tiers, players will have to manage their vault space with extreme care, as players vault space in Destiny 2 isn’t going to be expanded in The Edge of Fate expansion.

After Destiny 2’s ‘Sunset Reversal’ Controversy, Players Won’t Give Up Their Old Gear So Easily

It ultimately seems like only a matter of time until the new generation of buildcrafting tools in The Edge of Fate expansion for Destiny 2 will eventually replace players' existing meta weapons and armor. However, even long after this time comes, many players will likely want to keep their hard-earned, god-roll legendary weapons and artifice armor safely stored, just in case this old gear one day makes a comeback as the new meta. While this may sound far-fetched, this same thing recently happened with Destiny 2 ’s Sunset reversal controversy, where the restrictions placed on old gear were abruptly removed, and these armor and weapons were once again made viable in endgame content.

Hence, the Sunset reversal controversy arguably makes longtime players justified in not wanting to free up vault space in Destiny 2 by permanently deleting their old gear, especially since the majority of this gear can no longer be reacquired now that The Final Shape expansion has been released. Unfortunately, this makes the new meta buildcrafting tools in Destiny 2 seem like a controversy waiting to happen, despite how powerful they may be.

item.title: Ready Or Not: Best Weapons, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Ready or Not features 4 weapon categories - Assault Rifles, Shotguns, SMGs, and Pistols. Players must choose their loadout carefully to survive missions.
  • The VKS and Beanbag Shotgun are non-lethal weapons that can help players detain enemies instead of killing them.
  • The MPX is a fast-reloading SMG that allows players to unload bullets quickly without worrying about running out of ammo.

Ready or Not features 4 categories of weapons, Assault Rifles, Shotguns, SMGs, and Pistols. These categories all have their own advantages, but players can only bring one primary weapon and one secondary weapon into every Ready or Not mission, so players are going to have to spend some time in the arsenal to figure out what the correct loadout would be to survive every encounter and gain that elusive S Rank.

The best weapons in Ready or Not will certainly help players in hostile situations, but a level of skill is still required, as players will need to be like John Wick if they are supposed to survive one of the hardest but best tactical shooters of 2025. Ready or Not ’s best weapons feature both lethal and non-lethal choices for all.

Updated on July 15, 2025, by Jake Fillery: Ready or Not's Los Suenos Stories update brings a few new weapons into the fray, and some of them might have just changed the meta to get the S rank for good. Look below to see the ranking for the best Ready or Not weapons, and which ones you should add to your loadout for the next battle against crime.

23 LVAR

A Carbine Rifle With a Built-in Suppressor

The LVAR is one of the best guns in the game for a few reasons. Firstly, it's one of the most well-designed weapons, and it's always nice to run into battle with a gun that looks as good as it feels to fire. On the topic of firing, it's going to be a quiet delight due to its built-in suppressor.

With most guns looking better than they feel, the LVAR certainly stands out, and the fact that a suppressor is added to it automatically makes it one of the better weapons, and its attachments are rather freeing for more personalized use.

22 MCX

A Popular and Modern Assault Rifle for Performance and Customization

There's a good reason why the MCX is a popular choice among law enforcement who jump into the game ready for action. It's a smaller carbine rifle, one that provides a brilliant performance with a great option for customization.

The MCX has a myriad of potential with its recoil control and magazine capacity, and it functions as one of the best assault rifles that will certainly aid players across their combat experiences. With its stopping power, most engagements will end with one shot.

21 SLR47

An AK-Based Assault Rifle With Reliable Control

The AK47 is a classically designed weapon that features in practically every modern shooter, and the SLR47 brings forth that trend with some tactical realism. The appearance itself is great for those who simply adore this weapon, even if its shorter and stubbier design could warrant that of an AKS-74U.

Performance-wise, it's a competent choice, a weapon that can mostly 2-tap enemies, which helps drop them fast and quick, even those armored to the teeth. Its appearance is fun, and its recoil doesn't provide greatness in heavy engagements, so try to keep shooting accurately to see the true benefits of this gun.

20 Tactical Shield

Protect Against Direct Fire With This Tactical

The Tactical Shield is something that all players can equip as their tactical addition, but it's also something that can only be used with sidearms. As such, it's not wise to run in with just a Tactical Shield, as players might have an incredible defense, but they will also have nothing to return fire with, thus leaving them in a pretty vulnerable spot. Armed with a sidearm, players can navigate dangerous areas and take direct fire to the face, thanks to the safety and competent durability of the Tactical Shield. Be warned; it can shatter, and it's not wise to stay out in the open with this slow-moving support weapon.

19 M14S-16

A Battle Rifle For Sharpshooters

Not many players prefer to play with a rifle in single-fire mode, and that's why the M14S-16 also offers an auto mode as well. However, that is not the recommended fire mode as the recoil is really difficult to control, especially knowing that no vertical grip can be installed on the weapon.

That being said, M14S-16 does feel powerful when used as a single-fire marksman rifle. That is where this weapon excels. Giving the sharpshooters a joyful feel of what a decades-old weapon is capable of doing in modern chaotic engagements.

18 F90

A Compact Bullpup Rifle Ideal For Close Quarters And Long Ranges

The F90 is a great Assault Rifle choice for those who want something that retains its roots with an SMG twist. The F90 is a compact weapon, and it truly shines when it comes to maneuverability and adapting to tight corners and small rooms. This makes the F90 a decent choice for combat, as it can deal with enemies quickly thanks to its responsive fire rate and recoil, and the longer barrel allows it to be used at further distances than a shotgun or SMG just wouldn't be able to hit.

17 MP5SD6

A Reliable SMG With A Built-In Silencer

Inheriting the same base as MP5, the MP5SD6 is a special build that comes with a silencer equipped by default, which is the reason why it is pretty quiet, even when compared to other weapons with a suppressor on their muzzle. So, it is indeed the best option for anyone thinking of a solo run and does need to fight quietly.

Aside from being quite silent, the weapon also comes with a very slight and quite controllable vertical recoil, which is just what every MP5 is known for. So, this weapon is actually suitable for using with magnified scopes, though that might not be every player's preference.

16 MP5A3

A Modern Marvel SMG With Incredible Recoil

Some players might want something a little more agile to bring into the field. For those players, it's best to look at the MP5A3 SMG, which comes as a more modern version of the MP5, with major improvements to its design and handling. The MP5A3 is lightweight, allowing players to move faster, and its lack of recoil makes it so easy to use, as players will be aiming at targets and unleashing bullets of fury with little kick to stop their accuracy. The MP5A3 can fire fast and accurately with little resistance, making it a competent pick.

15 .357 Magnum

A Revolver That Kicks Hard, But Hits Harder

It wouldn't seem fair to not have any side-arms on the list, and although they are often not the main weapon players should use, it's hard to deny that they can provide a certain kick that would be necessary against armored targets. The .357 Magnum is a classic, and fans of 80s cop movies might appreciate the nostalgia of this weapon, although sometimes nostalgia doesn't outshine usefulness. This weapon is extremely powerful, but having only 6 shots and being a nightmare to reload can make it a tad annoying in the field, so it's best reserved for unsuspecting enemies, or those whom players know they can confidently take out in one shot; just don't expect an incapacitation.

14 G19

A Reliable Sidearm Pistol For Agile Players

Competence is the key to a good loadout, and bringing along a trusty side-arm is the way to go. Whilst there is nothing inherently unique about the G19, that doesn't mean it cannot impress. It's a great side-arm, with consistent stats throughout that will easily help players in their battle against crime. The rate of fire is decent, and the ammo capacity is nice, allowing players to fire off multiple shots to try and incapacitate enemies, or more if they want them dead. It's a reliable sidearm, and that's really all players need out of a pistol since it isn't their main weapon.
